snippet: Problems with prosecutorial misconduct seem to be piling up in the Queens district attorney’s office, now that another felon has sued seeking to overturn his conviction.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column on lawsuit seeking to overturn the conviction of Petros Bedi, for fatal shooting of man in an Astoria nightclub in 2000; newly disclosed witness protection records show that the Queens district attorney's office paid witness Seraphim Koumpouras for hotel bills in exchange for testimony; holds that prosecutorial misconduct has become a legal sore in plain sight in the office of Queens DA Richard A Brown.
lead_paragraph: Problems with prosecutorial misconduct seem to be piling up in the Queens district attorney’s office, now that another felon has sued seeking to overturn his conviction.

headline.seo: New Charge of Prosecutorial Misconduct in Queens
